Posts.Content: Be careful  of oral thrush with Docetaxol. I've just had my last cycle and I can feel it kicking in. I'm prescribed Nystatin and Fluconazole. They work well fir ne !
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: As a cancer patient you should get priority with appointments. I only have to say 'bring up my records'and I get an appointment immediately. Can you get telephone consultations? What anti sickness drugs have you been given? Docetaxol is a nasty bugger but there are meds which will help. xx
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: Since I started chemo I've had a craving for meat,  which after 9 years vegetarian  was a bit strange,  but what the heck.  If that's what my body wanted,  so be it. Now chemo is over for a while I'm hoping my tastes go back to normal.
Posts.Title: I am reading lots of info re diet and did not realise a change was...

Posts.Content: I was saying much the same thing to the gentleman friend this afternoon, 6 months ago we'd paid for our holiday and were busy counting down the days. But now we've started a new countdown to the end of the chemo and a weekend away somewhere peaceful where we can relax and forget it all for a while.
Posts.Title: How life has changed

Posts.Content: Luckily I've avoided the works annual trip to the German Market...sick leave can be useful ! But I do long for a theatre trip, haven't been since March. One good thing though...concessions for disabled now !
Posts.Title: How life has changed

Posts.Content: I was dx with breast primary and bone (spine) secondary all at the same time. The word 'incurable' hit hard at first but here I am, almost 2 years on feeling good with pretty much everything under control. Remember, incurable doesn't always mean terminal. Keep on keepin' on x Bon
Posts.Title: Cancer in spine

Posts.Content: My diet throughout the bad week was 'soft and sweet'. Then when my appetite returned, I only ate what I fancied. I'm lucky as my Son was staying with me at the time so he was quite happy to not have to cook big meals. Little and often and if you only fancy cake, then sobeit!
Posts.Title: Food changes

Posts.Content: I've got mild joint pain and fatigue but some of that may well be the remainder of the chemo. On the whole I feel ok and any discomfort is controlled with paracetamol and ibuprofen. All the signs are that the side effects will improve as time goes on. xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozolum

Posts.Content: Just tried Philly and crackers, a long time lunch favourite. .yuk ! Back to the drawing board !
Posts.Title: TAX - Sore Mouth - What to Eat?

Posts.Content: My daughter is on her way with a fresh supply of instant porridge and a portion of home made chili! ..I had a new chest of drawers from Argos last week.....ooer....
Posts.Title: TAX - Sore Mouth - What to Eat?

Posts.Content: Yesterday I was in pain and miserable. Today, (8th day from 2nd chemo) I've eaten a hearty breakfast and done my own ironing for the first time in 3 months! Never, ever, thought I would be telling the interweb how happy I am about ironing.
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Just got back from seeing my oncologist. My lump has shrunk from 3 x 2 cm to 1x1 after just 2 chemo sessions !!! And...I picked up the new motor today too....my cup runneth over... :-)
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Thank you ladies, I was dreading my next session on Monday but I'm going into it with a different viewpoint now.
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Administered my injection myself today...... Chuffed !
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Hi Ethel, wyen I work out how, I'd be glad to !
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Administered my injection myself today...... Chuffed !
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Lovely, gossipy, cream cake eating, Christmas planning afternoon with my girls. Got my nails done too.. .
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Got an email from work last night, they're going to pay me another 2 weeks full pay because they were late in letting me know I was going down to SSP and my 15.5 days outstanding leave allowance is going to be paid too! On top of that, they have offered to pay my transport each way to the works Christmas do.....my cup runneth over !
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Just found some mixed nuts in the cupboard...keeping me going !
Posts.Title: TAX - Sore Mouth - What to Eat?

Posts.Content: Hi Ethel, wyen I work out how, I'd be glad to !
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: So jealous Claire, I need a weekend away so badly . We've had to cancel so many trips and holidays recently, I feel cursed ! Make sure you get to Bettys tea room and have a cake for me xx
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: You were lucky Claire! Must be the time of year but we couldn't get a booking in April!
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Lovely, gossipy, cream cake eating, Christmas planning afternoon with my girls. Got my nails done too.. .
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: So jealous Claire, I need a weekend away so badly . We've had to cancel so many trips and holidays recently, I feel cursed ! Make sure you get to Bettys tea room and have a cake for me xx
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Just did my third too..feeling really quite well! Bit of a sore throat but resting for a couple of days. (Excuse?) :-)
Posts.Title: What a different experience this time

Posts.Content: I had mine done after my first chemo. It's settled down and working fine. Much easier. Xx
Posts.Title: Finally getting my portacath fitted yeah xxx

Posts.Content: Cheery news.....just had a call, my new car is ready and I've arranged to collect it on the 27th Nov. I'm soooooo excited !! Come on girls, what made you smile today ? Xx
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Another KPI. I've just been out by myself for the first time since all this started. Knackered now but v. happy!
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: I was out last night, dinner with a friend. Then woke at 4! Slight sore throat but it seems to have worn off . Got 2 days of rest planned now while the usual kicks in, hoping to be back to norm by the weekend. It seems to be getting easier with each one (fingers crossed) :-)
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: I couldnt eat anything for a day or so but then went on to soft and sweet. Instant porridge, cake and custard etc.got back to 'normal' after about 4 days. It is trial and error but Nystatin is brilliant as is Difflam when you're really sore x
Posts.Title: TAX - Sore Mouth - What to Eat?

Posts.Content: And to finish off, I just managed to eat ginger cake and custard. Not the ideal staple diet I'm sure but if it goes down..... (and stays there! ). :-) roll on tomorrow's good news !
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: 2 cracking wigs bought...I could have spent a fortune! Followed by a lovely meal on the way back. All PJ'd up and warm in my chair for the evening.
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: I was out last night, dinner with a friend. Then woke at 4! Slight sore throat but it seems to have worn off . Got 2 days of rest planned now while the usual kicks in, hoping to be back to norm by the weekend. It seems to be getting easier with each one (fingers crossed) :-)
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: You were lucky Claire! Must be the time of year but we couldn't get a booking in April!
Posts.Title: YAY!!

Posts.Content: Hi 4paws, I had 6 months on this treatment and yes, it is awful but my oncologist assures me that nothing else is as bad. I got through it by keeping a diary. The pattern soon formed that after treatment on Monday, I would wake up with a sore throat on Tuesday morning. Thursday afternoon brought loss of appetite and joint pain. This lasted until day 10 when I would start to feel human again.  I must admit that although I had anti-sickness tablets, I didn't take them and was never sick. Make sure you avoid anyone with an infection and if your temp goes above 38, call your team immediately. I found sponge puddings with custard to be the best I could eat...get a stock in! x Bon p.s. If you need any further info, I'll dig out the diary :)
Posts.Title: Docetaxel & Herceptin side affects

Posts.Content: I find that from day 3 to 6 I don't worry about food. My diet at that time consists of biscuits, cake and custard with the occasional sip of soup to satisfy the savoury urge. Keeping hydrated is more important but as your mouth is dry,  do ask for meds for thrush.
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Hi Susie,  I'm doing ok apart from a chest infection (boo). 2 weeks away from my last chemo and counting. About to start discussions about a  return to work in April, 2 holidays booked....keeping busy !
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: What is a look good feel good session ?
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Understood, I had a similar session some months ago at my local cancer support centre but I ended up showing them  more than they showed me!!  Very nice mineral make up set though and my Daughter got one too...  :-)
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Hi all.., I have Denosumab injections in the stomach every 6 weeks but I couldn't say definitely that it causes any side effects as I have all the most common side effects (fatigue, joint pain etc...) from all my other treatments anyway. One thing it has caused is Osteonecrosis in my upper right jaw, it's rare but after being referred to a Maxillo-Facial Consultant, I am on permanent anti-biotics and all seems under control now. Make sure that your dental hygiene routine is at full max and that your dentist is aware that you are on Bisphosphonates.  I'm with Carolyn on the temperature..anything over 38 needs attention, call your BC team straight away as it may be a marker for infection. (I've had 2 nasty ones in the last 6 weeks that have resulted in being admitted and endless days on a drip). Sorry, I can't be of more help. x Bon
Posts.Title: Bisphosphonate side effects

Posts.Content: I too had a portacath after my first chemo. My surgeon decided to do it under GA but I was in and out of hospital in 5 hours, no problems. It is so much easier than finding a vein every time. I had a blood transfusion through it in the first 3 days too. Highly recommended.
Posts.Title: About to start chemo. Implantable port/central line?

Posts.Content: Hi Dee, I already had a gum problem (years of smoking even though I stopped over 10 years ago) so when I had to have a tooth extracted, the gum wouldn't heal and there was and still is, dead bone poking through. This doesn't give me any problem and should fall away in due course. The good news is that permanent anti biotics have stabilised the problem and when I had to have another tooth out a few months after, there were no problems at all. Please don't over think it, the condition is still very rare but it is important that while on Bisphosphonates you take extra care with your dental hygiene. I use Corsodyl toothpaste and mouthwash along with interdental brushes at least twice a day and make sure I see my Dentist every 3 months. Hope this helps, x Bon
Posts.Title: Bisphosphonate side effects

Posts.Content: That's pants...mine didn't start coming off until after I'd finished chemo but they are recovering quite well now. My team gave me antibiotic (eye) drops to put down the nails to prevent infection and it worked. (sorry, can't remember what it was called, I'll have a look when I get home) I wore plasters and gloves for about 3 weeks to prevent ripping until they started to grow and now I'm using stick on nails to cover them while they grow back. Hope this helps...there is light at the end of the tunnel!
Posts.Title: Nails lifting off after one dose of taxotere

Posts.Content: ..and gloves. I bought cotton ones for sleeping in and a box of latex ones for everything else!
Posts.Title: Nails lifting off after one dose of taxotere

Posts.Content: That rings a bell!  The way I see it,  you may well lose your nails in the end but it's a damned good excuse for a weekly manicure in the meantime!
Posts.Title: Nails lifting off after one dose of taxotere

Posts.Content: Sorry Sue,  I've just checked the branch of Boots that is my bathroom cabinet and I must have thrown the antibiotic drops away.  I'm in for my  treatment next Monday, I'll try to remember to ask the team what it was  x
Posts.Title: Nails lifting off after one dose of taxotere

Posts.Content: Sod Boots...ask your team for a prescription. You have your exemption..  :)
Posts.Title: Nails lifting off after one dose of taxotere

Posts.Content: You're almost there, don't give in now! I felt the same coming up to my last one as my 5th was marred with a chest infection and shingles too. It's now 7 weeks and I'm feeling better every day. You've got this far, you can do one more. xxxx
Posts.Title: Is The Third Tax The Worst?

Posts.Content: Had mine done under a general, drove myself home after a couple of hours. Chemo in/bloods out no problem. X
Posts.Title: port

Posts.Content: Hate to break the news but mine flatly refuses to grow back...along with underarm hair (even on the one that didn't have surgery) my eyelashes are on their way back but my eyebrows ...nada.  Legs have gone from needing a daily shave to once a fortnight at best and the hair on my head resembles a used Brillo pad. x Bon
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I feel odd...I can still do 12-14 hours sleep come what may. Have to set the alarm at 10 hours or I get headaches. Or just miss breakfast....
Posts.Title: Four in the morning

Posts.Content: One has to speculate to accumulate and having said my piece on one particular campaign, I am more than happy with the 'Lonely' campaign as it actually truthful. x Bon
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I first expressed my distaste of this campaign last year but was greeted with stony silence.. Same as when I asked why Race for Life was aimed at women only.  X Bon
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Just to let you know,  the first hair to grow back is chin and upper lip.  No holds barred there..  :(
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: As galling as it is,  I don't see this as Channel 4's fault. Rather than a diatribe,  maybe request that they listen to and report the other side of the story? X Bon
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I'm so jealous Julia,  18 months after my first chemo and my hair still resembles cress growing out of an eggshell.  :)  Bon
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: A colleague  (in another office) did the Brave the Shave last year but really only had a haircut! I donated because she donated her hair to the Princess trust  and in fairness she did raise £1k for Macmillan. (The whole company felt press ganged into it though with weekly emails putting pressure on which I found distasteful TBH... ) :( I'd much rather have seen her sitting in  bath of baked beans! x Bon p.s. losing my hair never bothered me...losing everything else really hurts.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I have disliked this campaign from day one as I believe that it trivialises what it actually means to be treated for cancer. Losing my hair was the least of my worries..they never mention:- Losing your eyebrows, eyelashes and every other hair on your body Fingernails and toenails coming off Your entire digestive system turning inside out Not having the strength to do the simplest of tasks without support Loss of libido A constant feeling of impending doom Grief for the life you have had to leave behind Or is Joe Public too damned precious to know the truth? x Bon
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Usually, once I've told them I'm incurable they're quite keen to shut up and go away !
Posts.Title: Fed up of cancer being the focus ...

Posts.Content: If it wasn't for a CT scan my cancer wouldn't have been found and I probably wouldn't be here now. Thank Zeus they are routine.
Posts.Title: Scans

Posts.Content: We're all guilty of saying the wrong thing when we don't know what to say!  I just smile and thank them for their concern.  C**p happens to all of us at some point, we never know what form it will take but we have to face things head on or they will beat us. I see my cancer as just that. My brother has the blinkers on and refuses to accept my prognosis, giving me the usual platitudes and clichés but I just change the subject to shut him up and get on with what I want to do!  I've gone past sad and angry now though the occasional  cry creeps in (and a good cry makes us feel better doesn't it?)  Now I can get out a little more,  I don't feel so lonely.  Keep your chin up and keep control,  it's your life xxx
Posts.Title: feeling sad angry lonely and lots more

Posts.Content: For me, the first cycle was by far the worst. After that, it only lasted about 3 days but knowing it was coming, I could prepare for it. I found Difflam mouthwash  very good (ask your oncologist). There are lots of medications out there to help and just look forward to that day when you can eat a meal again! x Bon
Posts.Title: Sore mouth

Posts.Content: The only thing I could eat from day 3 to 6 was Ginger cake and custard. My excuse and I'm sticking to it ;) x Bon
Posts.Title: Sore mouth

Posts.Content: Well done you...I've delegated to my youngest...well, he did volunteer !
Posts.Title: I am feeling so brave

Posts.Content: Like all things, its the unknown that frightens us. Just had my 2nd and feeling like an old hand at it now ! You will be fine and remember to ask questions, the nursing staff are marvellous x
Posts.Title: First Chemo Today - Moral Support Request

Posts.Content: P.S. cry if you want ! It's a great release from the tension .
Posts.Title: First Chemo Today - Moral Support Request

Posts.Content: What meds have you been given for the side effects ?
Posts.Title: 5th chemo..vile

Posts.Content: I'm afraid the fatigue is with you for the duration Bev. I've learned to accept it now and ask for help, rest is the only answer. I've got vitamin B6 tablets for the numb fingers and find oatmeal baths help with the skin. Keep moisturising!!. As for the mouth, I've now got Caphosol (Google it) which has no taste but coats the mouth well and helps me through my bad week. X
Posts.Title: 5th chemo..vile

Posts.Content: Crying is a release, allow yourself a wallow and then give yourself a treat. It's perfectly normal, we've enough to beat ourselves up about without denying being human ! Xxx
Posts.Title: How can I stop myself crying?

Posts.Content: Too right Maggie....I woke up this morning, it's a good day. If I do the sme tomorrow, that will be good too especially as it's my Grandson's 16th birthday!!!!
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: ..and WHY can you not look glamorous because you have cancer?? From day one I have been damned if I will look ill. On the bad days during chemo I wallowed for sure but as soon as I felt better, out came the make up bag!!
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Hi Susie, I've been very busy lately..life is full of appointments...spray tan, eyelash extensions, nail extensions...oh and a couple of Dr's when I could find the time..  :)
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: I'm not sure my outlook is much different than before...just a bit more urgent!
Posts.Title: lost a nail

Posts.Content: Keep going Avi ! I'm 4 weeks past my last docetaxol,  still weak but eating normally.  I felt that it would never end too but here I am. And you're right,  it has nothing to do with strength. We do what we have to do Xx
Posts.Title: Horrible Taste in Mouth

Posts.Content: Hi Rosalyn...If only my hair was long enough for extensions!! They say you shouldn't do a lot of things but so far I've bleached the little hair I had with no adverse effects, wear false eyelashes when I want to, had a spray tan and wear false nails on the horrible stubs that chemo left me. I'm quite happy wearing wigs and scarves but should the mood take me, I'll go for extensions too. Extensions don't go near your blooodstream anyway and a good hairdresser will do a proper job x
Posts.Title: hair extensions

Posts.Content: Oh yes, I still have to make notes or tell people to remind me where I've put things. Still losing the odd word mid sentence but it is improving slowly. {almost 2 months post chemo]. I can still remember where the corkscrew lives though  :-)
Posts.Title: chemo fog

Posts.Content: In fairness,  my heart scans are done in a separate part of the hospital from the cancer suite and the 'nurse' that attends  as chaperone and to help me dress is usually a nursing assistant.
Posts.Title: If a nurse doesn't even know.... !!

Posts.Content: We all have dark moments, that's perfectly natural but that's when I log in and sometimes just read how other people are coping. I always go away from here with renewed determination.
Posts.Title: Another newbi

Posts.Content: It is normal to be worried about the unknown and chemo is not always fun but you will get lots of support, plenty of meds to help deal with side effects and very often a successful outcome. Do you know which chemo you will be having? There is always someone here who has gone through it and can help you  x Bon
Posts.Title: Having a wobble

Posts.Content: I lost all 20 of mine within 6 weeks of finishing Docetaxol too! They grew back quite nicely but have gone brittle again after 6 months on Capecitabine. I'm just keeping them really short and painted in the hope they'll gain strength.  I've only just started Tamoxifen so would be interested to find out if it does have any effect on nails. x Bon
Posts.Title: Nails breaking and coming away from Nail bed

Posts.Content: The point that needs to be made is that although breast cancer is largely curable these days, SBC isn't. I had an acquaintance say to me only 2 days ago.. 'Breast cancer? You'll be fine in a while. It's marvellous what they can do'. I didn't have the time (or the patience) to explain that I am not going to be cured, I have survived my initial 6 month prognosis because of good palliative care and largely ignoring the sword of Damocles dangling over me. SBC is the invisible, poor relation in the cancer family and needs publicity and research. We do not want sympathy just a share in the shouting.
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: I'm not offended at all! But we're all grown ups and being upset now and then is part of life. There are things that upset me a lot more than cancer (don't ask...we'll be here for days...!) I do hope your Dad is getting all the care he needs. xx
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: Oh how right strawb, I've developed a system of turning  a conversation when anyone says how brave and positive I am.  A smile and a thank you and an enquiry about their children,  job,  nasty cold whatever.  5 minutes of smiling and nodding and I can usually escape!
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: I've now found the video in question and although I shed a tear,  I also cheered inside. It's like she crept into my mind and took my words.
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: Thank you sister snail for the kind words but you have missed my point. That lady wasn't being insensitive at all and I didn't take any offence. She and many, many others have a pink feather boa view of breast cancer that is promoted by charity fundraisers and in my view, trivialises and sentimentalises a very serious issue. All the publicity tells us that we are more likely to survive breast cancer than not but there is no mention of SBC. Maybe it's only happy endings that encourage people to donate. I don't think I've seen the video in question but will definitely have a dig around for it now. Please don't take this as bitterness, I am probably happier now than I've ever been, my concern is that without awareness of SBC, no real research will be funded and many more people will have to face their mortality sooner than expected.
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: Cheers G...I was dashing out to work and didn't have time to sort the link out  :)
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: I can't get annoyed,  let's face it.. before we were diagnosed would  any of us have instinctively known the right thing to say?  I take it in the spirit in which it is given but have left strict instructions with the children that when I'm gone the phrase  'battle bravely borne' and the wearing of pink is banned!
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: Hi Ali,  type 'Holly Rothell Kitchen' into YouTube and you'll find it easily x
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: Most of the time during chemo I couldn't eat anything at all! so if I fancied it, I had it, regardless. :)
Posts.Title: Food question.?

Posts.Content: See your nurse or GP. Cankles are common but 2-3 daysof water tablets sorts it out. You all have prescription exemption..why buy overpriced 'stuff' from Holland and Barrett? (or online when you can't be sure what you're buying?)
Posts.Title: Food question.?

Posts.Content: I wasn't bothered about losing my hair and it's starting to grow back now [but not before my chin hair!]. It was losing my nails that upset me most.  :(
Posts.Title: extremely dry scalp
